static struct __pyx_vtabstruct_11CARTGVutils_PriorityHeap *__pyx_vtabptr_11CARTGVutils_PriorityHeap;


 160:     """A priority queue implemented as a binary heap.
 161:     The heap invariant is that the impurity improvement of the parent record
 162:     is larger then the impurity improvement of the children.
 163:     Attributes
 164:     ----------
 165:     capacity : SIZE_t
 166:         The capacity of the heap
 167:     heap_ptr : SIZE_t
 168:         The water mark of the heap; the heap grows from left to right in the
 169:         array ``heap_``. The following invariant holds ``heap_ptr < capacity``.
 170:     heap_ : PriorityHeapRecord*
 171:         The array of heap records. The maximum element is on the left;
 172:         the heap grows from left to right
 173:     """
 174:

 282:     """A priority queue class, always sorted in increasing order.
 283:     Attributes
 284:     ----------
 285:     capacity : SIZE_t
 286:         The capacity of the priority queue.
 287:     array_ptr : SIZE_t
 288:         The water mark of the priority queue; the priority queue grows from
 289:         left to right in the array ``array_``. ``array_ptr`` is always
 290:         less than ``capacity``.
 291:     array_ : WeightedPQueueRecord*
 292:         The array of priority queue records. The minimum element is on the
 293:         left at index 0, and the maximum element is on the right at index
 294:         ``array_ptr-1``.
 295:     """

struct __pyx_vtabstruct_11CARTGVutils_WeightedMedianCalculator {

  __pyx_t_11CARTGVutils_DOUBLE_t (*get_median)(struct __pyx_obj_11CARTGVutils_WeightedMedianCalculator *);
};
static struct __pyx_vtabstruct_11CARTGVutils_WeightedMedianCalculator *__pyx_vtabptr_11CARTGVutils_WeightedMedianCalculator;


 433:     """A class to handle calculation of the weighted median from streams of
 434:     data. To do so, it maintains a parameter ``k`` such that the sum of the
 435:     weights in the range [0,k) is greater than or equal to half of the total
 436:     weight. By minimizing the value of ``k`` that fulfills this constraint,
 437:     calculating the median is done by either taking the value of the sample
 438:     at index ``k-1`` of ``samples`` (samples[k-1].data) or the average of
 439:     the samples at index ``k-1`` and ``k`` of ``samples``
 440:     ((samples[k-1] + samples[k]) / 2).
 441:     Attributes
 442:     ----------
 443:     initial_capacity : SIZE_t
 444:         The initial capacity of the WeightedMedianCalculator.
 445:     samples : WeightedPQueue
 446:         Holds the samples (consisting of values and their weights) used in the
 447:         weighted median calculation.
 448:     total_weight : DOUBLE_t
 449:         The sum of the weights of items in ``samples``. Represents the total
 450:         weight of all samples used in the median calculation.
 451:     k : SIZE_t
 452:         Index used to calculate the median.
 453:     sum_w_0_k : DOUBLE_t
 454:         The sum of the weights from samples[0:k]. Used in the weighted
 455:         median calculation; minimizing the value of ``k`` such that
 456:         ``sum_w_0_k`` >= ``total_weight / 2`` provides a mechanism for
 457:         calculating the median in constant time.
 458:     """
 459: 
+460:     def __cinit__(self, SIZE_t initial_capacity):
